column4: Can someone please help me install some sound drivers, I dont quiet understand how.

uncompress the source file, be sure you have all needed stuff installed (install build-essential package)  cd to the source dir, then normally its a ' ./configure then make, then sudo make install' commands.
would you please step by step guide me?
yes, ok i uncompressed it to desktop
it uncompressed an actual folder and it says the same name w/o the .tar.bz2 on the end.
cd to the source dir that it made.. and read the install docs. The standard procedure is './configure' 'make' then 'sudo make install'
I dont quiet understand, Im not used to a terminal still (being a user coming from windows) if you wouldnt mind to download this file and tell me exactly so I do not mess up please?
or I could pastebin the instructions to you.
if that may help then theres the instructions.
those docs seem rather clear and detailed. There a specific part you are not understanding?
I am just not good at understanding directions, I sorry for so much trouble.
open up a  shell. cd to the dir the source is in,  the commands are './configure' then 'make ' then 'sudo make install'
unless your system has some of the specific cases/issues those readmens mention.
what do you mean to open a shell. dir?
if you dont understand the basics of the linux terminal. Its time to read some of the bash/shell/terminal starter guides.
